page.title: 08HISTORY
page.content: OUR BLOCK CONTAINS THE ORIGINAL CITY OF SALISBURY WHICH IS CALLED OLD SARUM. THIS WAS ORIGINALLY AN IRON AGE FORTRESS OF THREE RING AND DITCHES. THE AREA WAS ALSO THE SITE OF A ROMAN SETTLEMENT. IN 1025 BISHOP HERMON PLANNED THE BUILDING OF A CATHEDRAL ON THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THIS WAS FINALLY COMPLETED IN 1092 BY BISHOP OSMUND. UNFORTUNATELY WITHIN A WEEK OF CONSECRATION A SEVERE STORM CAUSED CONSIDERABLE DAMAGE TO THE CATHEDRAL. THE REMAINS OF THE ORIGINAL BUILDING ARE STILL TO BE SEEN ON THE SITE. OLD SARUM WAS ONE OF THE LAST OF THE ROTTEN BOROUGHS AND A COMMEMMORATIVE STONE HAS BEEN ERECTED ON THE SITE OF THE PARLIAMENT TREE WHERE THE ELECTIONS USED TO BE HELD. THE PITTS WERE NOTABLE MEMBERS ELECTED FROM THIS PARISH.
